page.title: 13Coaley Village.
page.content: Coaley is a small village lying at the foot of the range of Cotswold Hills which includes, Coaley Peak a well known beauty spot with views over the Berkeley Vale towards the River Severn and the Welsh Hills. It is claimed to be the longest village in England, with its long, winding lanes it stretches from the A38 to Uley. There has been a village here for many years. At one time it was called Cowley which means village of cows. Some parts of the church, Saint Bartholomews, are over 500 years old. Almost all the children between 5 and 11 years of age attend the village school which was built in 1864. The village has one shop cum post office which sells all neccessities. Coaley has a water powered mill fed by a stream which runs through the village.
